title: 112_hr1670
content: The "Sikes Act Amendments Act of 2011" improves coverage of state-owned facilities used for national defense under the Sikes Act. The Sikes Act is amended to include definitions for "State" and "State-owned National Guard installation" to encompass various territories and training lands. The Sikes Act is amended to include definitions for "State" and "State-owned National Guard installation" to cover different territories and training lands. The National Guard, funded by the Secretary of Defense or a military department, can develop integrated natural resources management plans for State-owned National Guard installations. The Sikes Act is amended to include definitions for "State" and "State-owned National Guard installation" to cover different territories and training lands. Integrated natural resources management plans for State-owned National Guard installations must be developed and implemented in coordination with the State's chief executive officer. The Sikes Act is amended to include definitions for "State" and "State-owned National Guard installation" to cover different territories and training lands. Amendments include inserting clauses and redesignating subparagraphs for consistency in the management of military installations. The Sikes Act is amended to include coordination with State chief executive officers for State-owned National Guard installations. Subsection (b) is updated to include State-owned National Guard installations in the management of military installations. Subparagraphs in subsection (b)(1) are revised to replace "military installation" with "installation". The Sikes Act is amended to include coordination with State chief executive officers for State-owned National Guard installations. Subsection (b) is updated to include State-owned National Guard installations in the management of military installations. Subparagraphs in subsection (b)(1) are revised to replace "military installation" with "installation". Additionally, section and subsection headings in the Act are amended to reflect these changes. The Sikes Act is amended to include coordination with State chief executive officers for State-owned National Guard installations. Subsection (b) is updated to include State-owned National Guard installations in the management of military installations. Subparagraphs in subsection (b)(1) are revised to replace "military installation" with "installation". Section and subsection headings in the Act are amended to reflect these changes. Section 101 is modified to include provisions on conservation and rehabilitation plans, while Section 102 is amended to address hunting permits for migratory game birds. The Sikes Act is amended to include coordination with State chief executive officers for State-owned National Guard installations. Section 102 is amended to address hunting permits for migratory game birds. Section 103a is further amended to include cooperative and interagency agreements for land management on installations. The Sikes Act is amended to include coordination with State chief executive officers for State-owned National Guard installations. Sections 104 and 105 are also amended to address liability for funds and applicability to other laws and national forest lands, respectively. Section 105 of the Sikes Act is amended to address applicability to other laws and national forest lands. Section 108 is also amended to address appropriations and expenditures. Section 108 of the Sikes Act is amended to address appropriations and expenditures, including authorizations to the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of the Interior. Section 201 is also amended to include additional provisions. Section 201 of the Sikes Act is amended to focus on wildlife, fish, and game conservation and rehabilitation programs. This includes changes to subsections (a) and (b) by specifying required programs and their implementation. Additionally, Section 202 is amended to address comprehensive plans for conservation and rehabilitation programs. Section 202 of the Sikes Act is amended to include comprehensive plans for conservation and rehabilitation programs, with changes made to subsections (a) to (d). Section 203 is also amended. "Section 204 of the Sikes Act is amended to include enforcement provisions." Section 204 of the Sikes Act is amended to include enforcement provisions such as violations and penalties, enforcement powers and proceedings, seizure and forfeiture, and applicability of customs laws. Section 205 is amended to include definitions, and Section 206 is also amended. Section 206 of the Sikes Act is amended to exempt Forest Service and Bureau of Land Management lands from stamp requirements and authorized fees. Section 207 is amended to address Indian rights and jurisdiction, while Section 209 is amended to authorize appropriations. Section 204(b) of the Sikes Act is amended to change "magistrate" to "magistrate judge". Section 208 of the Act is repealed. Repeal of Section 208 of the Sikes Act, with section 209 redesignated as section 208.
